item.title: Workarounds for archiving large shapefile in data lake
item.description: If you work with spatial data, chances are you are familiar with shapefile, a file format for viewing / editing spatial data. Essentially, shapefile is just a tabular data like csv, but it does thingamajig with geometry data type, where any gis tools like qgis or arcgis can understand right away. If you have a csv file with geometry column in wkt format (something like POLYGON ((30 10, 40 40, 20 40, 10 20, 30 10))), you’ll have to specify which column is to be used for geometry.
